meanings.definition: To search deeply or carefully in.
meanings.sent1: She decided to delve into the mystery to find the missing clue.
meanings.sent2: I like to delve into books to learn new things.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to delve into the old case files to solve the crime.
meanings.sent4: Her mind began to delve into the memories of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The explorer would delve into the depths of the jungle to uncover hidden treasures.

meanings.sent1: The scientist will delve into the data to find the answer.
meanings.sent2: Students often delve into topics they find interesting.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to delve into the mystery of the disappearing treats.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for history led her to delve into ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent5: The journalist would delve into the truth behind the scandal.

meanings.sent1: The archaeologist will delve into the ground to uncover artifacts.
meanings.sent2: Miners delve into the earth to extract valuable minerals.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to delve into the backyard to bury its bone.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree delve deep into the soil for nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew will delve into the construction site to lay the foundation.
